name: gmail
title: Gmail API
description: Access Gmail mailboxes including sending user email.

parameters.name: userIp
parameters.desc: IP address of the site where the request originates. Use this if you want to enforce per-user limits.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.desc: Selector specifying which fields to include in a partial response.

parameters.name: key
parameters.desc: API key. Your API key identifies your project and provides you with API access, quota, and reports. Required unless you provide an OAuth 2.0 token.

parameters.name: oauth_token
parameters.desc: OAuth 2.0 token for the current user.

parameters.name: prettyPrint
parameters.desc: Returns response with indentations and line breaks.

parameters.name: quotaUser
parameters.desc: Available to use for quota purposes for server-side applications. Can be any arbitrary string assigned to a user, but should not exceed 40 characters. Overrides userIp if both are provided.

fields.name: disposition
fields.desc: The state that a message should be left in after it has been forwarded.

fields.name: emailAddress
fields.desc: Email address to which all incoming messages are forwarded. This email address must be a verified member of the forwarding addresses.

fields.name: enabled
fields.desc: Whether all incoming mail is automatically forwarded to another address.

schemas.name: Label
schemas.desc: Labels are used to categorize messages and threads within the user's mailbox.

fields.name: labelListVisibility
fields.desc: The visibility of the label in the label list in the Gmail web interface.

fields.name: messagesTotal
fields.desc: The total number of messages with the label.

fields.name: threadsTotal
fields.desc: The total number of threads with the label.

fields.name: threadsUnread
fields.desc: The number of unread threads with the label.

fields.name: id
fields.desc: The immutable ID of the label.

fields.name: messageListVisibility
fields.desc: The visibility of the label in the message list in the Gmail web interface.

fields.name: messagesUnread
fields.desc: The number of unread messages with the label.

fields.name: name
fields.desc: The display name of the label.

fields.name: type
fields.desc: The owner type for the label. User labels are created by the user and can be modified and deleted by the user and can be applied to any message or thread. System labels are internally created and cannot be added, modified, or deleted. System labels may be able to be applied to or removed from messages and threads under some circumstances but this is not guaranteed. For example, users can apply and remove the INBOX and UNREAD labels from messages and threads, but cannot apply or remove the DRAFTS or SENT labels from messages or threads.

fields.name: sendAs
fields.desc: List of send-as aliases.

fields.name: labelIds
fields.desc: List of IDs of labels applied to this message.

fields.name: payload
fields.desc: The parsed email structure in the message parts.

fields.name: raw
fields.desc: The entire email message in an RFC 2822 formatted and base64url encoded string. Returned in messages.get and drafts.get responses when the format=RAW parameter is supplied.

fields.name: snippet
fields.desc: A short part of the message text.

fields.name: historyId
fields.desc: The ID of the last history record that modified this message.

fields.name: id
fields.desc: The immutable ID of the message.

fields.name: internalDate
fields.desc: The internal message creation timestamp (epoch ms), which determines ordering in the inbox. For normal SMTP-received email, this represents the time the message was originally accepted by Google, which is more reliable than the Date header. However, for API-migrated mail, it can be configured by client to be based on the Date header.

fields.name: sizeEstimate
fields.desc: Estimated size in bytes of the message.

fields.name: threadId
fields.desc:
The ID of the thread the message belongs to. To add a message or draft to a thread, the following criteria must be met: 
- The requested threadId must be specified on the Message or Draft.Message you supply with your request. 
- The References and In-Reply-To headers must be set in compliance with the RFC 2822 standard. 
- The Subject headers must match.

schemas.name: WatchRequest
schemas.desc: Set up or update a new push notification watch on this user's mailbox.

fields.name: topicName
fields.desc:
A fully qualified Google Cloud Pub/Sub API topic name to publish the events to. This topic name **must** already exist in Cloud Pub/Sub and you **must** have already granted gmail "publish" permission on it. For example, "projects/my-project-identifier/topics/my-topic-name" (using the Cloud Pub/Sub "v1" topic naming format).

Note that the "my-project-identifier" portion must exactly match your Google developer project id (the one executing this watch request).

fields.name: labelFilterAction
fields.desc: Filtering behavior of labelIds list specified.

fields.name: labelIds
fields.desc: List of label_ids to restrict notifications about. By default, if unspecified, all changes are pushed out. If specified then dictates which labels are required for a push notification to be generated.

schemas.name: Filter
schemas.desc: Resource definition for Gmail filters. Filters apply to specific messages instead of an entire email thread.

fields.name: action
fields.desc: Action that the filter performs.

fields.name: criteria
fields.desc: Matching criteria for the filter.

fields.name: id
fields.desc: The server assigned ID of the filter.

fields.name: drafts
fields.desc: List of drafts.

fields.name: nextPageToken
fields.desc: Token to retrieve the next page of results in the list.

fields.name: resultSizeEstimate
fields.desc: Estimated total number of results.

fields.name: history
fields.desc: List of history records. Any messages contained in the response will typically only have id and threadId fields populated.

fields.name: historyId
fields.desc: The ID of the mailbox's current history record.

fields.name: nextPageToken
fields.desc: Page token to retrieve the next page of results in the list.

fields.name: addLabelIds
fields.desc: A list of IDs of labels to add to this message.

fields.name: removeLabelIds
fields.desc: A list IDs of labels to remove from this message.

fields.name: expiration
fields.desc: When Gmail will stop sending notifications for mailbox updates (epoch millis). Call watch again before this time to renew the watch.

fields.name: historyId
fields.desc: The ID of the mailbox's current history record.

fields.name: labelIds
fields.desc: Label IDs added to the message.

fields.name: forwardingAddresses
fields.desc: List of addresses that may be used for forwarding.

fields.name: smimeInfo
fields.desc: List of SmimeInfo.

schemas.name: MessagePartBody
schemas.desc: The body of a single MIME message part.

fields.name: attachmentId
fields.desc: When present, contains the ID of an external attachment that can be retrieved in a separate messages.attachments.get request. When not present, the entire content of the message part body is contained in the data field.

fields.name: data
fields.desc: The body data of a MIME message part as a base64url encoded string. May be empty for MIME container types that have no message body or when the body data is sent as a separate attachment. An attachment ID is present if the body data is contained in a separate attachment.

fields.name: size
fields.desc: Number of bytes for the message part data (encoding notwithstanding).

schemas.name: SendAs
schemas.desc: Settings associated with a send-as alias, which can be either the primary login address associated with the account or a custom "from" address. Send-as aliases correspond to the "Send Mail As" feature in the web interface.

fields.name: isDefault
fields.desc: Whether this address is selected as the default "From:" address in situations such as composing a new message or sending a vacation auto-reply. Every Gmail account has exactly one default send-as address, so the only legal value that clients may write to this field is true. Changing this from false to true for an address will result in this field becoming false for the other previous default address.

fields.name: isPrimary
fields.desc: Whether this address is the primary address used to login to the account. Every Gmail account has exactly one primary address, and it cannot be deleted from the collection of send-as aliases. This field is read-only.

fields.name: sendAsEmail
fields.desc: The email address that appears in the "From:" header for mail sent using this alias. This is read-only for all operations except create.

fields.name: signature
fields.desc: An optional HTML signature that is included in messages composed with this alias in the Gmail web UI.

fields.name: verificationStatus
fields.desc: Indicates whether this address has been verified for use as a send-as alias. Read-only. This setting only applies to custom "from" aliases.

fields.name: displayName
fields.desc: A name that appears in the "From:" header for mail sent using this alias. For custom "from" addresses, when this is empty, Gmail will populate the "From:" header with the name that is used for the primary address associated with the account.

fields.name: replyToAddress
fields.desc: An optional email address that is included in a "Reply-To:" header for mail sent using this alias. If this is empty, Gmail will not generate a "Reply-To:" header.

fields.name: smtpMsa
fields.desc: An optional SMTP service that will be used as an outbound relay for mail sent using this alias. If this is empty, outbound mail will be sent directly from Gmail's servers to the destination SMTP service. This setting only applies to custom "from" aliases.

fields.name: treatAsAlias
fields.desc: Whether Gmail should  treat this address as an alias for the user's primary email address. This setting only applies to custom "from" aliases.

fields.name: filter
fields.desc: List of a user's filters.

fields.name: resultSizeEstimate
fields.desc: Estimated total number of results.

fields.name: messages
fields.desc: List of messages.

fields.name: nextPageToken
fields.desc: Token to retrieve the next page of results in the list.

schemas.name: SmtpMsa
schemas.desc: Configuration for communication with an SMTP service.

fields.name: username
fields.desc: The username that will be used for authentication with the SMTP service. This is a write-only field that can be specified in requests to create or update SendAs settings; it is never populated in responses.

fields.name: host
fields.desc: The hostname of the SMTP service. Required.

fields.name: password
fields.desc: The password that will be used for authentication with the SMTP service. This is a write-only field that can be specified in requests to create or update SendAs settings; it is never populated in responses.

fields.name: port
fields.desc: The port of the SMTP service. Required.

fields.name: securityMode
fields.desc: The protocol that will be used to secure communication with the SMTP service. Required.

schemas.name: VacationSettings
schemas.desc: Vacation auto-reply settings for an account. These settings correspond to the "Vacation responder" feature in the web interface.

fields.name: enableAutoReply
fields.desc: Flag that controls whether Gmail automatically replies to messages.

fields.name: endTime
fields.desc: An optional end time for sending auto-replies (epoch ms). When this is specified, Gmail will automatically reply only to messages that it receives before the end time. If both startTime and endTime are specified, startTime must precede endTime.

fields.name: responseBodyHtml
fields.desc: Response body in HTML format. Gmail will sanitize the HTML before storing it.

fields.name: responseBodyPlainText
fields.desc: Response body in plain text format.

fields.name: responseSubject
fields.desc: Optional text to prepend to the subject line in vacation responses. In order to enable auto-replies, either the response subject or the response body must be nonempty.

fields.name: restrictToContacts
fields.desc: Flag that determines whether responses are sent to recipients who are not in the user's list of contacts.

fields.name: restrictToDomain
fields.desc: Flag that determines whether responses are sent to recipients who are outside of the user's domain. This feature is only available for G Suite users.

fields.name: startTime
fields.desc: An optional start time for sending auto-replies (epoch ms). When this is specified, Gmail will automatically reply only to messages that it receives after the start time. If both startTime and endTime are specified, startTime must precede endTime.

fields.name: ids
fields.desc: The IDs of the messages to delete.

fields.name: addLabelIds
fields.desc: A list of label IDs to add to messages.

fields.name: ids
fields.desc: The IDs of the messages to modify. There is a limit of 1000 ids per request.

fields.name: removeLabelIds
fields.desc: A list of label IDs to remove from messages.

schemas.name: History
schemas.desc: A record of a change to the user's mailbox. Each history change may affect multiple messages in multiple ways.

fields.name: messages
fields.desc: List of messages changed in this history record. The fields for specific change types, such as messagesAdded may duplicate messages in this field. We recommend using the specific change-type fields instead of this.

fields.name: messagesAdded
fields.desc: Messages added to the mailbox in this history record.

fields.name: messagesDeleted
fields.desc: Messages deleted (not Trashed) from the mailbox in this history record.

fields.name: id
fields.desc: The mailbox sequence ID.

fields.name: labelsAdded
fields.desc: Labels added to messages in this history record.

fields.name: labelsRemoved
fields.desc: Labels removed from messages in this history record.

fields.name: labelIds
fields.desc: Label IDs removed from the message.

fields.name: mimeType
fields.desc: The MIME type of the message part.

fields.name: partId
fields.desc: The immutable ID of the message part.

fields.name: parts
fields.desc: The child MIME message parts of this part. This only applies to container MIME message parts, for example multipart/*. For non- container MIME message part types, such as text/plain, this field is empty. For more information, see RFC 1521.

fields.name: body
fields.desc: The message part body for this part, which may be empty for container MIME message parts.

fields.name: filename
fields.desc: The filename of the attachment. Only present if this message part represents an attachment.

fields.name: headers
fields.desc: List of headers on this message part. For the top-level message part, representing the entire message payload, it will contain the standard RFC 2822 email headers such as To, From, and Subject.

fields.name: value
fields.desc: The value of the header after the : separator. For example, someuser@example.com.

fields.name: name
fields.desc: The name of the header before the : separator. For example, To.

schemas.name: FilterAction
schemas.desc: A set of actions to perform on a message.

fields.name: addLabelIds
fields.desc: List of labels to add to the message.

fields.name: forward
fields.desc: Email address that the message should be forwarded to.

fields.name: removeLabelIds
fields.desc: List of labels to remove from the message.

fields.name: sizeComparison
fields.desc: How the message size in bytes should be in relation to the size field.

fields.name: subject
fields.desc: Case-insensitive phrase found in the message's subject. Trailing and leading whitespace are be trimmed and adjacent spaces are collapsed.

fields.name: size
fields.desc: The size of the entire RFC822 message in bytes, including all headers and attachments.

fields.name: to
fields.desc: The recipient's display name or email address. Includes recipients in the "to", "cc", and "bcc" header fields. You can use simply the local part of the email address. For example, "example" and "example@" both match "example@gmail.com". This field is case-insensitive.

fields.name: excludeChats
fields.desc: Whether the response should exclude chats.

fields.name: from
fields.desc: The sender's display name or email address.

fields.name: hasAttachment
fields.desc: Whether the message has any attachment.

fields.name: negatedQuery
fields.desc: Only return messages not matching the specified query. Supports the same query format as the Gmail search box. For example, "from:someuser@example.com rfc822msgid: is:unread".

fields.name: query
fields.desc: Only return messages matching the specified query. Supports the same query format as the Gmail search box. For example, "from:someuser@example.com rfc822msgid: is:unread".

fields.name: addLabelIds
fields.desc: A list of IDs of labels to add to this thread.

fields.name: removeLabelIds
fields.desc: A list of IDs of labels to remove from this thread.

fields.name: autoExpunge
fields.desc: If this value is true, Gmail will immediately expunge a message when it is marked as deleted in IMAP. Otherwise, Gmail will wait for an update from the client before expunging messages marked as deleted.

fields.name: enabled
fields.desc: Whether IMAP is enabled for the account.

fields.name: expungeBehavior
fields.desc: The action that will be executed on a message when it is marked as deleted and expunged from the last visible IMAP folder.

fields.name: maxFolderSize
fields.desc: An optional limit on the number of messages that an IMAP folder may contain. Legal values are 0, 1000, 2000, 5000 or 10000. A value of zero is interpreted to mean that there is no limit.

fields.name: accessWindow
fields.desc: The range of messages which are accessible via POP.

fields.name: disposition
fields.desc: The action that will be executed on a message after it has been fetched via POP.

schemas.name: Thread
schemas.desc: A collection of messages representing a conversation.

fields.name: historyId
fields.desc: The ID of the last history record that modified this thread.

fields.name: id
fields.desc: The unique ID of the thread.

fields.name: messages
fields.desc: The list of messages in the thread.

fields.name: snippet
fields.desc: A short part of the message text.

schemas.name: Draft
schemas.desc: A draft email in the user's mailbox.

fields.name: id
fields.desc: The immutable ID of the draft.

fields.name: message
fields.desc: The message content of the draft.

fields.name: verificationStatus
fields.desc: Indicates whether this address has been verified and is usable for forwarding. Read-only.

fields.name: forwardingEmail
fields.desc: An email address to which messages can be forwarded.

fields.name: labels
fields.desc: List of labels.

fields.name: nextPageToken
fields.desc: Page token to retrieve the next page of results in the list.

fields.name: resultSizeEstimate
fields.desc: Estimated total number of results.

fields.name: threads
fields.desc: List of threads.

fields.name: emailAddress
fields.desc: The user's email address.

fields.name: historyId
fields.desc: The ID of the mailbox's current history record.

fields.name: messagesTotal
fields.desc: The total number of messages in the mailbox.

fields.name: threadsTotal
fields.desc: The total number of threads in the mailbox.

fields.name: encryptedKeyPassword
fields.desc: Encrypted key password, when key is encrypted.

fields.name: expiration
fields.desc: When the certificate expires (in milliseconds since epoch).

fields.name: id
fields.desc: The immutable ID for the SmimeInfo.

fields.name: isDefault
fields.desc: Whether this SmimeInfo is the default one for this user's send-as address.

fields.name: issuerCn
fields.desc: The S/MIME certificate issuer's common name.

fields.name: pem
fields.desc: PEM formatted X509 concatenated certificate string (standard base64 encoding). Format used for returning key, which includes public key as well as certificate chain (not private key).

fields.name: pkcs12
fields.desc: PKCS#12 format containing a single private/public key pair and certificate chain. This format is only accepted from client for creating a new SmimeInfo and is never returned, because the private key is not intended to be exported. PKCS#12 may be encrypted, in which case encryptedKeyPassword should be set appropriately.

methods.name: getProfile
methods.desc: Gets the current user's Gmail profile.

pathParams.name: userId
pathParams.desc: The user's email address. The special value me can be used to indicate the authenticated user.

methods.name: stop
methods.desc: Stop receiving push notifications for the given user mailbox.

pathParams.name: userId
pathParams.desc: The user's email address. The special value me can be used to indicate the authenticated user.

methods.name: watch
methods.desc: Set up or update a push notification watch on the given user mailbox.

pathParams.name: userId
pathParams.desc: The user's email address. The special value me can be used to indicate the authenticated user.

methods.name: patch
methods.desc: Updates the specified label. This method supports patch semantics.

pathParams.name: userId
pathParams.desc: The user's email address. The special value me can be used to indicate the authenticated user.

pathParams.name: id
pathParams.desc: The ID of the label to update.

methods.name: update
methods.desc: Updates the specified label.

pathParams.name: userId
pathParams.desc: The user's email address. The special value me can be used to indicate the authenticated user.

pathParams.name: id
pathParams.desc: The ID of the label to update.

methods.name: create
methods.desc: Creates a new label.

pathParams.name: userId
pathParams.desc: The user's email address. The special value me can be used to indicate the authenticated user.

methods.name: delete
methods.desc: Immediately and permanently deletes the specified label and removes it from any messages and threads that it is applied to.

pathParams.name: userId
pathParams.desc: The user's email address. The special value me can be used to indicate the authenticated user.

pathParams.name: id
pathParams.desc: The ID of the label to delete.

methods.name: get
methods.desc: Gets the specified label.

pathParams.name: userId
pathParams.desc: The user's email address. The special value me can be used to indicate the authenticated user.

pathParams.name: id
pathParams.desc: The ID of the label to retrieve.

methods.name: list
methods.desc: Lists all labels in the user's mailbox.

pathParams.name: userId
pathParams.desc: The user's email address. The special value me can be used to indicate the authenticated user.

methods.name: batchModify
methods.desc: Modifies the labels on the specified messages.

pathParams.name: userId
pathParams.desc: The user's email address. The special value me can be used to indicate the authenticated user.

methods.name: import
methods.desc: Imports a message into only this user's mailbox, with standard email delivery scanning and classification similar to receiving via SMTP. Does not send a message.

pathParams.name: userId
pathParams.desc: The user's email address. The special value me can be used to indicate the authenticated user.

optionalQueryParams.name: processForCalendar
optionalQueryParams.desc: Process calendar invites in the email and add any extracted meetings to the Google Calendar for this user.

optionalQueryParams.name: deleted
optionalQueryParams.desc: Mark the email as permanently deleted (not TRASH) and only visible in Google Vault to a Vault administrator. Only used for G Suite accounts.

optionalQueryParams.name: internalDateSource
optionalQueryParams.desc: Source for Gmail's internal date of the message.

optionalQueryParams.name: neverMarkSpam
optionalQueryParams.desc: Ignore the Gmail spam classifier decision and never mark this email as SPAM in the mailbox.

methods.name: send
methods.desc: Sends the specified message to the recipients in the To, Cc, and Bcc headers.

pathParams.name: userId
pathParams.desc: The user's email address. The special value me can be used to indicate the authenticated user.

methods.name: insert
methods.desc: Directly inserts a message into only this user's mailbox similar to IMAP APPEND, bypassing most scanning and classification. Does not send a message.

pathParams.name: userId
pathParams.desc: The user's email address. The special value me can be used to indicate the authenticated user.

optionalQueryParams.name: deleted
optionalQueryParams.desc: Mark the email as permanently deleted (not TRASH) and only visible in Google Vault to a Vault administrator. Only used for G Suite accounts.

optionalQueryParams.name: internalDateSource
optionalQueryParams.desc: Source for Gmail's internal date of the message.

methods.name: list
methods.desc: Lists the messages in the user's mailbox.

pathParams.name: userId
pathParams.desc: The user's email address. The special value me can be used to indicate the authenticated user.

optionalQueryParams.name: includeSpamTrash
optionalQueryParams.desc: Include messages from SPAM and TRASH in the results.

optionalQueryParams.name: labelIds
optionalQueryParams.desc: Only return messages with labels that match all of the specified label IDs.

optionalQueryParams.name: maxResults
optionalQueryParams.desc: Maximum number of messages to return.

optionalQueryParams.name: pageToken
optionalQueryParams.desc: Page token to retrieve a specific page of results in the list.

optionalQueryParams.name: q
optionalQueryParams.desc: Only return messages matching the specified query. Supports the same query format as the Gmail search box. For example, "from:someuser@example.com rfc822msgid: is:unread". Parameter cannot be used when accessing the api using the gmail.metadata scope.

methods.name: modify
methods.desc: Modifies the labels on the specified message.

pathParams.name: userId
pathParams.desc: The user's email address. The special value me can be used to indicate the authenticated user.

pathParams.name: id
pathParams.desc: The ID of the message to modify.

methods.name: trash
methods.desc: Moves the specified message to the trash.

pathParams.name: userId
pathParams.desc: The user's email address. The special value me can be used to indicate the authenticated user.

pathParams.name: id
pathParams.desc: The ID of the message to Trash.

methods.name: untrash
methods.desc: Removes the specified message from the trash.

pathParams.name: userId
pathParams.desc: The user's email address. The special value me can be used to indicate the authenticated user.

pathParams.name: id
pathParams.desc: The ID of the message to remove from Trash.

methods.name: batchDelete
methods.desc: Deletes many messages by message ID. Provides no guarantees that messages were not already deleted or even existed at all.

pathParams.name: userId
pathParams.desc: The user's email address. The special value me can be used to indicate the authenticated user.

methods.name: delete
methods.desc: Immediately and permanently deletes the specified message. This operation cannot be undone. Prefer messages.trash instead.

pathParams.name: userId
pathParams.desc: The user's email address. The special value me can be used to indicate the authenticated user.

pathParams.name: id
pathParams.desc: The ID of the message to delete.

methods.name: get
methods.desc: Gets the specified message.

pathParams.name: userId
pathParams.desc: The user's email address. The special value me can be used to indicate the authenticated user.

pathParams.name: id
pathParams.desc: The ID of the message to retrieve.

optionalQueryParams.name: format
optionalQueryParams.desc: The format to return the message in.

optionalQueryParams.name: metadataHeaders
optionalQueryParams.desc: When given and format is METADATA, only include headers specified.

methods.name: get
methods.desc: Gets the specified message attachment.

pathParams.name: userId
pathParams.desc: The user's email address. The special value me can be used to indicate the authenticated user.

pathParams.name: messageId
pathParams.desc: The ID of the message containing the attachment.

pathParams.name: id
pathParams.desc: The ID of the attachment.

methods.name: updatePop
methods.desc: Updates POP settings.

pathParams.name: userId
pathParams.desc: User's email address. The special value "me" can be used to indicate the authenticated user.

methods.name: updateVacation
methods.desc: Updates vacation responder settings.

pathParams.name: userId
pathParams.desc: User's email address. The special value "me" can be used to indicate the authenticated user.

methods.name: getAutoForwarding
methods.desc: Gets the auto-forwarding setting for the specified account.

pathParams.name: userId
pathParams.desc: User's email address. The special value "me" can be used to indicate the authenticated user.

methods.name: getImap
methods.desc: Gets IMAP settings.

pathParams.name: userId
pathParams.desc: User's email address. The special value "me" can be used to indicate the authenticated user.

methods.name: getPop
methods.desc: Gets POP settings.

pathParams.name: userId
pathParams.desc: User's email address. The special value "me" can be used to indicate the authenticated user.

methods.name: getVacation
methods.desc: Gets vacation responder settings.

pathParams.name: userId
pathParams.desc: User's email address. The special value "me" can be used to indicate the authenticated user.

methods.name: updateAutoForwarding
methods.desc:
Updates the auto-forwarding setting for the specified account. A verified forwarding address must be specified when auto-forwarding is enabled.

This method is only available to service account clients that have been delegated domain-wide authority.

pathParams.name: userId
pathParams.desc: User's email address. The special value "me" can be used to indicate the authenticated user.

methods.name: updateImap
methods.desc: Updates IMAP settings.

pathParams.name: userId
pathParams.desc: User's email address. The special value "me" can be used to indicate the authenticated user.

methods.name: get
methods.desc: Gets a filter.

pathParams.name: userId
pathParams.desc: User's email address. The special value "me" can be used to indicate the authenticated user.

pathParams.name: id
pathParams.desc: The ID of the filter to be fetched.

methods.name: list
methods.desc: Lists the message filters of a Gmail user.

pathParams.name: userId
pathParams.desc: User's email address. The special value "me" can be used to indicate the authenticated user.

methods.name: create
methods.desc: Creates a filter.

pathParams.name: userId
pathParams.desc: User's email address. The special value "me" can be used to indicate the authenticated user.

methods.name: delete
methods.desc: Deletes a filter.

pathParams.name: userId
pathParams.desc: User's email address. The special value "me" can be used to indicate the authenticated user.

pathParams.name: id
pathParams.desc: The ID of the filter to be deleted.

methods.name: create
methods.desc:
Creates a forwarding address. If ownership verification is required, a message will be sent to the recipient and the resource's verification status will be set to pending; otherwise, the resource will be created with verification status set to accepted.

This method is only available to service account clients that have been delegated domain-wide authority.

pathParams.name: userId
pathParams.desc: User's email address. The special value "me" can be used to indicate the authenticated user.

methods.name: delete
methods.desc:
Deletes the specified forwarding address and revokes any verification that may have been required.

This method is only available to service account clients that have been delegated domain-wide authority.

pathParams.name: userId
pathParams.desc: User's email address. The special value "me" can be used to indicate the authenticated user.

pathParams.name: forwardingEmail
pathParams.desc: The forwarding address to be deleted.

methods.name: get
methods.desc: Gets the specified forwarding address.

pathParams.name: userId
pathParams.desc: User's email address. The special value "me" can be used to indicate the authenticated user.

pathParams.name: forwardingEmail
pathParams.desc: The forwarding address to be retrieved.

methods.name: list
methods.desc: Lists the forwarding addresses for the specified account.

pathParams.name: userId
pathParams.desc: User's email address. The special value "me" can be used to indicate the authenticated user.

methods.name: create
methods.desc:
Creates a custom "from" send-as alias. If an SMTP MSA is specified, Gmail will attempt to connect to the SMTP service to validate the configuration before creating the alias. If ownership verification is required for the alias, a message will be sent to the email address and the resource's verification status will be set to pending; otherwise, the resource will be created with verification status set to accepted. If a signature is provided, Gmail will sanitize the HTML before saving it with the alias.

This method is only available to service account clients that have been delegated domain-wide authority.

pathParams.name: userId
pathParams.desc: User's email address. The special value "me" can be used to indicate the authenticated user.

methods.name: delete
methods.desc:
Deletes the specified send-as alias. Revokes any verification that may have been required for using it.

This method is only available to service account clients that have been delegated domain-wide authority.

pathParams.name: userId
pathParams.desc: User's email address. The special value "me" can be used to indicate the authenticated user.

pathParams.name: sendAsEmail
pathParams.desc: The send-as alias to be deleted.

methods.name: get
methods.desc: Gets the specified send-as alias. Fails with an HTTP 404 error if the specified address is not a member of the collection.

pathParams.name: userId
pathParams.desc: User's email address. The special value "me" can be used to indicate the authenticated user.

pathParams.name: sendAsEmail
pathParams.desc: The send-as alias to be retrieved.

methods.name: list
methods.desc: Lists the send-as aliases for the specified account. The result includes the primary send-as address associated with the account as well as any custom "from" aliases.

pathParams.name: userId
pathParams.desc: User's email address. The special value "me" can be used to indicate the authenticated user.

methods.name: patch
methods.desc:
Updates a send-as alias. If a signature is provided, Gmail will sanitize the HTML before saving it with the alias.

Addresses other than the primary address for the account can only be updated by service account clients that have been delegated domain-wide authority. This method supports patch semantics.

pathParams.name: userId
pathParams.desc: User's email address. The special value "me" can be used to indicate the authenticated user.

pathParams.name: sendAsEmail
pathParams.desc: The send-as alias to be updated.

methods.name: update
methods.desc:
Updates a send-as alias. If a signature is provided, Gmail will sanitize the HTML before saving it with the alias.

Addresses other than the primary address for the account can only be updated by service account clients that have been delegated domain-wide authority.

pathParams.name: userId
pathParams.desc: User's email address. The special value "me" can be used to indicate the authenticated user.

pathParams.name: sendAsEmail
pathParams.desc: The send-as alias to be updated.

methods.name: verify
methods.desc:
Sends a verification email to the specified send-as alias address. The verification status must be pending.

This method is only available to service account clients that have been delegated domain-wide authority.

pathParams.name: userId
pathParams.desc: User's email address. The special value "me" can be used to indicate the authenticated user.

pathParams.name: sendAsEmail
pathParams.desc: The send-as alias to be verified.

methods.name: delete
methods.desc: Deletes the specified S/MIME config for the specified send-as alias.

pathParams.name: userId
pathParams.desc: The user's email address. The special value me can be used to indicate the authenticated user.

pathParams.name: sendAsEmail
pathParams.desc: The email address that appears in the "From:" header for mail sent using this alias.

pathParams.name: id
pathParams.desc: The immutable ID for the SmimeInfo.

methods.name: get
methods.desc: Gets the specified S/MIME config for the specified send-as alias.

pathParams.name: userId
pathParams.desc: The user's email address. The special value me can be used to indicate the authenticated user.

pathParams.name: sendAsEmail
pathParams.desc: The email address that appears in the "From:" header for mail sent using this alias.

pathParams.name: id
pathParams.desc: The immutable ID for the SmimeInfo.

methods.name: insert
methods.desc: Insert (upload) the given S/MIME config for the specified send-as alias. Note that pkcs12 format is required for the key.

pathParams.name: userId
pathParams.desc: The user's email address. The special value me can be used to indicate the authenticated user.

pathParams.name: sendAsEmail
pathParams.desc: The email address that appears in the "From:" header for mail sent using this alias.

methods.name: list
methods.desc: Lists S/MIME configs for the specified send-as alias.

pathParams.name: userId
pathParams.desc: The user's email address. The special value me can be used to indicate the authenticated user.

pathParams.name: sendAsEmail
pathParams.desc: The email address that appears in the "From:" header for mail sent using this alias.

methods.name: setDefault
methods.desc: Sets the default S/MIME config for the specified send-as alias.

pathParams.name: userId
pathParams.desc: The user's email address. The special value me can be used to indicate the authenticated user.

pathParams.name: sendAsEmail
pathParams.desc: The email address that appears in the "From:" header for mail sent using this alias.

pathParams.name: id
pathParams.desc: The immutable ID for the SmimeInfo.

methods.name: delete
methods.desc: Immediately and permanently deletes the specified thread. This operation cannot be undone. Prefer threads.trash instead.

pathParams.name: userId
pathParams.desc: The user's email address. The special value me can be used to indicate the authenticated user.

pathParams.name: id
pathParams.desc: ID of the Thread to delete.

methods.name: get
methods.desc: Gets the specified thread.

pathParams.name: userId
pathParams.desc: The user's email address. The special value me can be used to indicate the authenticated user.

pathParams.name: id
pathParams.desc: The ID of the thread to retrieve.

optionalQueryParams.name: metadataHeaders
optionalQueryParams.desc: When given and format is METADATA, only include headers specified.

optionalQueryParams.name: format
optionalQueryParams.desc: The format to return the messages in.

methods.name: list
methods.desc: Lists the threads in the user's mailbox.

pathParams.name: userId
pathParams.desc: The user's email address. The special value me can be used to indicate the authenticated user.

optionalQueryParams.name: includeSpamTrash
optionalQueryParams.desc: Include threads from SPAM and TRASH in the results.

optionalQueryParams.name: labelIds
optionalQueryParams.desc: Only return threads with labels that match all of the specified label IDs.

optionalQueryParams.name: maxResults
optionalQueryParams.desc: Maximum number of threads to return.

optionalQueryParams.name: pageToken
optionalQueryParams.desc: Page token to retrieve a specific page of results in the list.

optionalQueryParams.name: q
optionalQueryParams.desc: Only return threads matching the specified query. Supports the same query format as the Gmail search box. For example, "from:someuser@example.com rfc822msgid: is:unread". Parameter cannot be used when accessing the api using the gmail.metadata scope.

methods.name: modify
methods.desc: Modifies the labels applied to the thread. This applies to all messages in the thread.

pathParams.name: userId
pathParams.desc: The user's email address. The special value me can be used to indicate the authenticated user.

pathParams.name: id
pathParams.desc: The ID of the thread to modify.

methods.name: trash
methods.desc: Moves the specified thread to the trash.

pathParams.name: userId
pathParams.desc: The user's email address. The special value me can be used to indicate the authenticated user.

pathParams.name: id
pathParams.desc: The ID of the thread to Trash.

methods.name: untrash
methods.desc: Removes the specified thread from the trash.

pathParams.name: userId
pathParams.desc: The user's email address. The special value me can be used to indicate the authenticated user.

pathParams.name: id
pathParams.desc: The ID of the thread to remove from Trash.

methods.name: get
methods.desc: Gets the specified draft.

pathParams.name: userId
pathParams.desc: The user's email address. The special value me can be used to indicate the authenticated user.

pathParams.name: id
pathParams.desc: The ID of the draft to retrieve.

optionalQueryParams.name: format
optionalQueryParams.desc: The format to return the draft in.

methods.name: list
methods.desc: Lists the drafts in the user's mailbox.

pathParams.name: userId
pathParams.desc: The user's email address. The special value me can be used to indicate the authenticated user.

optionalQueryParams.name: includeSpamTrash
optionalQueryParams.desc: Include drafts from SPAM and TRASH in the results.

optionalQueryParams.name: maxResults
optionalQueryParams.desc: Maximum number of drafts to return.

optionalQueryParams.name: pageToken
optionalQueryParams.desc: Page token to retrieve a specific page of results in the list.

optionalQueryParams.name: q
optionalQueryParams.desc: Only return draft messages matching the specified query. Supports the same query format as the Gmail search box. For example, "from:someuser@example.com rfc822msgid: is:unread".

methods.name: send
methods.desc: Sends the specified, existing draft to the recipients in the To, Cc, and Bcc headers.

pathParams.name: userId
pathParams.desc: The user's email address. The special value me can be used to indicate the authenticated user.

methods.name: update
methods.desc: Replaces a draft's content.

pathParams.name: userId
pathParams.desc: The user's email address. The special value me can be used to indicate the authenticated user.

pathParams.name: id
pathParams.desc: The ID of the draft to update.

methods.name: create
methods.desc: Creates a new draft with the DRAFT label.

pathParams.name: userId
pathParams.desc: The user's email address. The special value me can be used to indicate the authenticated user.

methods.name: delete
methods.desc: Immediately and permanently deletes the specified draft. Does not simply trash it.

pathParams.name: userId
pathParams.desc: The user's email address. The special value me can be used to indicate the authenticated user.

pathParams.name: id
pathParams.desc: The ID of the draft to delete.

methods.name: list
methods.desc: Lists the history of all changes to the given mailbox. History results are returned in chronological order (increasing historyId).

pathParams.name: userId
pathParams.desc: The user's email address. The special value me can be used to indicate the authenticated user.

optionalQueryParams.name: startHistoryId
optionalQueryParams.desc: Required. Returns history records after the specified startHistoryId. The supplied startHistoryId should be obtained from the historyId of a message, thread, or previous list response. History IDs increase chronologically but are not contiguous with random gaps in between valid IDs. Supplying an invalid or out of date startHistoryId typically returns an HTTP 404 error code. A historyId is typically valid for at least a week, but in some rare circumstances may be valid for only a few hours. If you receive an HTTP 404 error response, your application should perform a full sync. If you receive no nextPageToken in the response, there are no updates to retrieve and you can store the returned historyId for a future request.

optionalQueryParams.name: historyTypes
optionalQueryParams.desc: History types to be returned by the function

optionalQueryParams.name: labelId
optionalQueryParams.desc: Only return messages with a label matching the ID.

optionalQueryParams.name: maxResults
optionalQueryParams.desc: The maximum number of history records to return.

optionalQueryParams.name: pageToken
optionalQueryParams.desc: Page token to retrieve a specific page of results in the list.
